title: Quiz 7: Safety, Infection Control & Anaesthesia
description: Procedures for scrubbing, patient positioning, and types of anaesthesia.

questions.question: Order the steps of the surgical scrubbing procedure:
questions.explanation: Social wash first, then scrub each arm, then rinse properly.

questions.question: When scrubbing with ordinary soap, the recommended duration is ___BLANK___ to ___BLANK___ minutes.
questions.explanation: Ordinary soap requires 10-15 minutes of scrubbing.

questions.question: Why is Atropine administered as pre-medication? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Atropine dries secretions and prevents slow heart rate. It is not a sedative or analgesic.

questions.question: Match the local anaesthesia method to its description:
questions.explanation: Spinal goes into spinal fluid; Epidural into epidural space; Infiltration is local; Nerve block targets a specific nerve.
questions.hint: Spinal vs Epidural is the tricky one.

questions.question: Which surgical position involves the patient lying supine with legs raised in stirrups?

richContent.content: Position Description: Patient on back, buttocks at edge of table, legs elevated and supported. Used for perineal operations.

questions.explanation: Lithotomy position is used for perineal operations.

questions.question: When gloving, you should touch the outside of the glove with your bare hand.
questions.explanation: You must only touch the *inside* folded part of the glove with your bare hand to maintain sterility of the outer glove.
questions.hint: Sterile to sterile, unsterile to unsterile.

questions.question: Which anaesthetic agent is highly inflammable in the presence of diathermy?
questions.explanation: Ether is volatile and highly inflammable.

questions.question: Which of the following are muscle relaxants? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Scoline and Pancuronium are relaxants. Pethidine is an analgesic; Thiopentone is an induction agent.

questions.question: What position is used for pelvic operations where the head is lowered?
questions.explanation: Trendelenburg position lowers the head to shift abdominal organs away from the pelvis.

questions.question: Which agent acts as a reversal for non-depolarizing muscle relaxants?
questions.explanation: Neostigmine reverses muscle relaxants (often given with Atropine).
